vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Σύρτις,
genitive εως, Ionic dialect ιος, also ιδος [Refs 2nd c.AD+], ἡ: (σύρω):— the Syrtis, name of two large shallow gulfs on the coast of Libya, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II metaphorically, destruction, ἄλλα δ᾽ ἄλλαν θραῦεν σ. [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ Syrtis
a shoal, sand-bank, a place dangerous on account of shoals, two of which were particularly famous on the northern coast of Africa, one lying near Carthage, and the other, the syrtis major, lying between Cyrene and Leptis, which is probably referred to in Acts 27:17*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: la Sirte (nombre de dos golfos pocos profundos y peligrosos, cercanos a la costa africana) (4 B-5)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
賽耳底
沿著利比亞海岸線的兩個海灣的名字,因其水淺而沙岸又浮動,水手都很怕.
#徒 27:17|提到的是面向Cyrenaica的所謂"大賽耳底"
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
赛耳底
沿着利比亚海岸线的两个海湾的名字,因其水浅而沙岸又浮动,水手都很怕.
#徒 27:17|提到的是面向Cyrenaica的所谓"大赛耳底"
